**Solution**.  
Since $\text{Cor}(X,Y)=1$ this means that $X$ and $Y$ are linear and $Y=aX+b$ for some constants $a>0, b$. 

-  $\prob(X>Y) = \prob(Y-X<0) = \prob(aX+b -X <0) = \prob((a-1)X+b<0) = \prob(X<\frac{-b}{a-1}) = 0.8413448$  
  Since `qnorm(0.8413448)`=1 this means that $\prob(X<1)=0.8413448$  
  So, $\prob(X<\frac{-b}{a-1}) = \prob(X<1)=0.8413448$  
  So, $\frac{-b}{a-1} = 1$  
  So, $-b=a-1$  

- $\prob(X<Y+1) = \prob(Y-X+1>0) = \prob(aX+b+1-X>0) = \prob((a-1)X+b+1>0) = \prob(X>\frac{-b-1}{a-1}) = 0.5$  
  Since $\prob(X>0) = 0.5$ this means that $\prob(X>\frac{-b-1}{a-1}) = \prob(X>0)$  
  So, $\frac{-b-1}{a-1}=0$  
  So, $b=-1$
  From above, $-b=a-1$ so $a=1-b$ which means that $a=2$.
  
So, $Y=2X-1$ where $X\sim\mathcal{N}(0,1)$  
So $Y$ is also normal, since the linear combination of normal variables is normal.  

- $\text{E}(Y) = \text{E}(2X-1) = 2\text{E}(X) -1 = -1$  
- $\text{Var}(Y) = \text{Var}(2X-1) = 2^2\text{Var}(X) = 4$

So, $Y\sim\mathcal{N}(-1,4)$ and $\prob(-2<Y<2) = \prob(Y<2) - \prob(Y<-2) =$ `pnorm(2,-1,4) - pnorm(-2,-1,4)`.
